intro: Circaea lalashanensis, commonly known as the Lalashan whiteflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and its stems are slender and often branched. Circaea lalashanensis is native to the mountainous regions of China, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
